Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Why should I play the Roman fool and die On mine own sword? Whiles I see lives, the gashes do better upon them.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Macduff
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Turn, hellhound, turn!

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Of all men else I have avoided thee. But get thee back. My soul is too much charged With blood of thine already.
Act5Scene8Part1.translation: Out of everyone, you are the one I have avoided. My soul is stained too much with the blood of your family already.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Macduff
Act5Scene8Part1.text: I have no words; My voice is in my sword.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Thou losest labor. I bear a charmèd life, which must not yield To one of woman born.
Act5Scene8Part1.translation: You are wasting your time. I lead a charmed life, and I can't be defeated by someone born from a woman.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Macduff
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Despair thy charm, and let the angel whom thou still hast served tell thee Macduff was from his mother’s womb untimely ripped.
Act5Scene8Part1.translation: Then you should despair. I was cut out from my mother's womb before I could be delivered naturally.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Accursèd be that tongue that tells me so, for it hath cowed my better part of man! And be these juggling fiends no more believed
Act5Scene8Part1.translation: Curse you for telling this, now my courage had left me. I no longer believe those tricky witches

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Macduff
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Then yield thee, coward, and live to be the show and gaze o’ th’ time.
Act5Scene8Part1.translation: Then surrender coward, and live on as an amusement we all point and laugh at.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene8Part1.text: I will not yield to kiss the ground before young Malcolm’s feet and to be baited with the rabble’s curse.
Act5Scene8Part1.translation: I will not surrender and kiss the ground before Malcolm's feet and to be mocked by commoners.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Lay on, Macduff, And damned be him that first cries “Hold! Enough!”

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene8Part1.text: I would the friends we miss were safe arrived.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Siward
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Some must go off; and yet by these I see So great a day as this is cheaply bought.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Macduff is missing, and your noble son.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Ross
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Your son, my lord, has paid a soldier’s debt.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Siward
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Then he is dead?

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Ross
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Ay, and brought off the field.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Siward
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Had he his hurts before?

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Ross
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Ay, on the front.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Siward
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Why then, God’s soldier be he!

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene8Part1.text: He’s worth more sorrow, and that I’ll spend for him.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Siward
Act5Scene8Part1.text: He’s worth no more. They say he parted well and paid his score.

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Macduff
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Hail, King! for so thou art. Behold where stands Th’ usurper’s cursèd head. The time is free. Hail, King of Scotland!

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: All
Act5Scene8Part1.text: Hail, King of Scotland!

Act5Scene8Part1.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene8Part1.text: We shall not spend a large expense of time before we reckon with your several loves and make us even with you. My thanes and kinsmen, henceforth be earls, the first that ever Scotland in such an honor named. What’s more to do, which would be planted newly with the time, So thanks to all at once and to each one, whom we invite to see us crowned at Scone.
